specific_changes.description: Changed from fixed pixel margin to responsive breakpoint-based margin using Material-UI sx prop

file_insights.impact: Enables proper layout adjustment on mobile devices by removing left margin on extra-small screens (xs) while maintaining the drawer offset on medium screens and above (md)

patterns_discovered.description: Using MUI's sx prop with breakpoint objects (xs, md, etc.) for responsive styling instead of CSS media queries
patterns_discovered.evidence: Changed ml property from static value to { xs: 0, md: `${DRAWER_WIDTH}px` }
patterns_discovered.applicability: Common in MUI-based React applications for mobile-first responsive design

patterns_discovered.description: Layout component uses a drawer with fixed width that requires dynamic margin adjustment on the main content area
patterns_discovered.evidence: DRAWER_WIDTH constant is used for precise offset calculation
patterns_discovered.applicability: Standard pattern for drawer-based navigation layouts

gotchas_discovered.description: Fixed margins on main content area can break mobile layouts where navigation drawers typically collapse or hide
gotchas_discovered.impact: Content area would be incorrectly offset on mobile devices without breakpoint awareness
gotchas_discovered.solution_applied: Used MUI breakpoint object with xs: 0 for mobile and md for desktop margins

gotchas_discovered.description: The implementation assumes drawer behavior changes at the md breakpoint - margin adjustment must align with actual drawer visibility/behavior at each breakpoint
gotchas_discovered.impact: If drawer doesn't actually hide at xs breakpoint, this could cause layout misalignment
gotchas_discovered.note: Requires verification that drawer component also uses same md breakpoint for visibility toggle

approach_outcome.summary: Successfully made the main content area responsive by converting fixed left margin to a breakpoint-aware responsive margin
approach_outcome.implementation_efficiency: Single line change with minimal modifications

recommendations.recommendation: Verify drawer component uses the same 'md' breakpoint for visibility/collapse behavior to ensure margin changes align with actual drawer state changes
Test responsive layout across all breakpoints (xs, sm, md, lg, xl) to ensure content area alignment matches drawer visibility at each breakpoint
Document the breakpoint mapping strategy (md breakpoint = drawer visible, xs = drawer hidden/collapsed) to maintain consistency if layout changes are needed
Consider extracting breakpoint logic into a constant or theme configuration to avoid hardcoding breakpoint keys if multiple responsive properties need similar breakpoint handling
